availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pulaski County and Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin Sadler. Married to Anna C. Irvine Sadler in Pulaski County, Kentucky, on September 26, 1832. Father of Joseph S. Sadler, Isaac M. Sadler, Lucinda Sadler, Frances Sadler, Manson F. Sadler, Leonard Sadler, Jemima Sadler, Gilly Sadler, Andrew J. Sadler, Melissa A. Sadler, and Samuel H. Sadler. Resident in Pulaski County in 1840. Farmer in Pulaski County in 1850. Farmer in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Pulaski, p. 326,
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Division 2, p. 119A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 64.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 1.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pulaski County Marriages, Film #000804052, p. 161.
Find A Grave, "Samuel Sadler (12 Jan 1812-21 Sep 1879)," Memorial #46627284, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46627284 (accessed September 24, 2020).
